definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: The reason of WANG Ting-gui resignation and retiremen lie wrong understanding in later generations.
sentences.chinese: 對於王庭珪辭官歸隱的原因，後人存在錯誤的認識。

sentences.english: Which ancient Chinese government official resigned because he refused to bow for five bushels of grain?
sentences.chinese: 因“不爲五斗米而折腰”而辭官的是以下哪一位？

sentences.english: He has hibernated for several years.
sentences.chinese: 他已經辭官退隱好多年了。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
